56fc716da0d8e614404cdcc8f081b68c: * The image provides a visual representation of the various potential outcomes of COVID-19 infection. The most common outcome is acute illness, which occurs in 1 out of 200 cases. This is followed by moderate-to-critical illness, which occurs in 1 out of 900 cases. COVID-19-associated myocarditis, a rare but serious complication of the virus, occurs in 1 out of 1,600 cases. Multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children (MIS-C) is a rare but potentially fatal condition that can occur in children who have been infected with COVID-19. MIS-C occurs in 1 to 3 out of every 3,000 children who contract COVID-19. Of those children who develop MIS-C, 1 to 2 out of every 100 will die. Long COVID, a condition characterized by persistent symptoms that can last for months or even years after the initial infection, occurs in approximately 1 out of 100 cases. The image also highlights the potential for unknown long-term effects of COVID-19, as well as the impact of the virus on children's mental health due to isolation and school closures. Finally, the image touches on the issue of community transmission and the emergence of variants of concern (VOCs).

9aeb208257bc393057b442046e4ffdb0: * The infographic illustrates the timeline of the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, a decades-long territorial dispute between Armenia and Azerbaijan. The timeline begins in 1921 when Nagorno-Karabakh, populated by mostly ethnic Armenians, becomes an autonomous region within the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic (SSR). In 1988, tensions escalate as Nagorno-Karabakh seeks unification with Armenia, leading to clashes with the Azerbaijan SSR. The conflict intensifies in 1991-1994, resulting in the deaths of around 30,000 people and the displacement of hundreds of thousands more. A ceasefire agreement is reached in 1994, but the conflict remains unresolved. In 2016, a four-day war between Armenia and Azerbaijan results in up to 100 military fatalities on each side. In 2020, the most significant fighting since the 1994 ceasefire starts on September 27 and concludes on November 10 with a new ceasefire agreement brokered by Russia.
